page.title: 11CULLOMPTON SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: The plant,opened in 1972,serves 6 150 houses.First the sewage goes into the pumping station where the solids are removed.A rake takes out all the paper and other things such as balls and false_teeth.The sludge is drawn off into settlement tanks.The liquid goes into filter beds where bacteria eat remaining solids.The bacteria live in the stones in the beds and live for 36 _ 72 hours.You should not put oil etc.down the drains because it kills the bacteria.To help the growth of bacteria,liquid is sprayed continuously to treat the stones. When treatment is finished the water from the sewage is returned to the river.The plant can cope,with a further 1 850 households so can handle some population growth.
